name: EMEX.C Engine
body:
Ever since I developed an MCTS algorithm for a Uni project I've been interested in AIs that play board games.

I want to develop one to play chess but before that I need an engine. I could just use one of the many open source ones, but I think the experience of building one, specially in C++, would be worthwhile.

name: pmark.pt
body:
My personal website build with Angular. I use it to talk about whatever I feel like and serves as a way to catalog my work.

Uses a serverless API powered by Azure Functions. Retrieves data from the Nexus Mods Public API for information about my mods.

name: emexmachina.com
body:
Fake studio website.
I came up with a fake studio name for a Uni project. The website was just for fun.

name: KD6-3.7
body: An AI capable of playing the board game Simplexity. Uses a Monte Carlo Tree Search algorithm.

name: Cillionaire
body: Quiz style game played on a command console. Built using C.

name: Shuffle
body:
A memory card game built with python.
For this project we were told that to get a higher grade than 16 we had to add extra features. I got the perfect grade for this project by developing an in-game music player and a high score manager that communicated with a Web API to save the best scores.

name: Excel Balance Check
body:
This desktop app allowed the company I work to at the time to compare excel sheets in a specific way, doing the work that used to take a couple of days, in a few clicks.
WPF GUI. C#

name: lemis.pt
body:
Company web presence website for a former employer.
Last time I checked it was offline and they don't have any other web presence. Don't really know what's going on there.

name: Felli
body: Felli board game playable on a command console.

name: Wolf and Sheep
body: Wolf and Sheep board game playable on a command console.

name: Python Projectile Physics
body: Bit of software built with python to calculate the trajectory of a physical object. Uses pygame for view.

name: Pandemic Sim
body: Console app that simulates a type of pandemic.
